text:
Hi all I am Tejas Tiwari, and I am beginning my journey contributing to the R ecosystem, with a strong interest in data analysis, reproducible research, and tooling that improves analytical workflows. Over the past period, I have worked extensively in RStudio, building and experimenting with projects that span data cleaning, exploratory analysis, statistical summarization, and visualization pipelines.
My work in R has involved designing structured analysis workflows, automating repetitive data preparation tasks, and using packages such as dplyr, tidyr, ggplot2, and janitor to produce clean, interpretable outputs from raw datasets. I have also focused on writing readable, modular R scripts and developing a habit of validating assumptions through summaries, tabulations, and sanity checks.
Through these projects, I developed a practical understanding of:
 Handling real-world, imperfect datasets
 Building reproducible analysis pipelines
 Interpreting statistical outputs rather than treating them as black boxes
 Debugging and understanding package-level behavior
I am now looking to contribute back by engaging with issues, documentation improvements, tests, and small feature enhancements, while learning established conventions used in R packages and the broader CRAN ecosystem. My goal is to grow as a contributor by writing clear, maintainable R code and collaborating constructively within open-source communities.
